name: Ginny Caspar
text: We love Bistro 231 and Missy! The food is good and Karen has always been a great server! Great specials at great prices! We go as often as we can! Their homemade chips and grilled cheese are my favorite go to there when I can't make up my mind. :-)

name: Ambre Harris
text: Very good food, had the broccoli cheese soup (made from scratch) and the best fish sandwich I've had in a long time. Very friendly service, very casual atmosphere. Didn't try dessert, but have been told it's made from scratch as well. Will definitely be back, would definitely recommend.

name: Kim Lovell
text: The food was really good. I had the lasagna,  salad and fresh baked bread. The bread was pretty doughy but maybe that's how it's supposed to be.  The staff was friendly, the owner came out and checked on us. The server was alone and running herself ragged. She was also the cashier. She was doing the best she could to keep up. That is the only issue we had. She needs help. We went at lunch so maybe it was busier than usual. We'll try it again at another time.

name: EVERYTHING CHILDERS
text:
The service was very attentive. Price wasn't bad.
The food was pretty to look at & well presented.
The quality & taste of the food left much to be desired. My sausage was hard & tough...appeared to be reheated meat.
My Moms spaghetti had water under the noodles. Not good.  The mustard greens looked great, however the taste wasn't recognizable.
I hope this resturant uses this for improvement & not insulting.  I left a tip anyway.
Sorry folks...  You can not imagine our disappointment, as well as our dissatisfaction.
Thank you

name: John Reed
text: Stopped in to try a new place and loved it. I had the hot Italian sandwich, it was warm and loaded with flavor. Our group of four also tried the daily special, the Philly and a BLT. The Philly cheese steak is really close to the ones I used to get on Bridge street near my grandmother's house in Philadelphia. The food was great, served quick and the staff was helpful and friendly. Price was a touch high in my opinion but I still feel it was worth it. This place is also veteran friendly! Give it a try if your close by!

name: Mindy Guffey
text: Great place to eat and family oriented. Has the best homemade  pizza's, homemade soups, and the daily specials are amazing. The staff is awesome an very much about the customers. I highly recommend if you haven't ate here you need to give it a try.

name: Giovonni Contino
text: Very classy, haven't tried there homeade Italian pizza but I'm sure its great. There fries are the best. I've been yearning to try there angel hair Alfredo many choices on the menu and day to day specials. All in all good service and good quality.

name: Scott Wood
text: The entrees are good as are many of the sides.  I recommend that they discontinue serving any canned greens, though.

name: Patrick Morris
text: Great food at a great price with excellent service.

name: Fred Pocius
text: Nice quiet friendly place to get a great dinner at fair price.

name: Dennis Medders
text: Good food friendly people and cozy

name: Kerry Weaver
text: This is one of the greatest places to eat. The cook is amazing and the staff is delightful.

name: laura doss
text: Great salads to go... If you are looking for a good tasting healthy meal, they rock!

name: Joyce Schroetlin
text: Very good food and very good service

name: Amanda Sather
text: Love love love love the food! Love love love the staff,  I visit every time I go see my parents.

name: Camille&Ben Richardson
text: Hey we just had the Italian sub over here at Bristol and it was fantastic one would have fed both of us came with french fries I'll be back again for this sandwich

name: James Owen
text: When does it open?

name: Boss Hog
text: So good

name: Allen Mabrey
text: Excellent

name: Debbie Heckler
text: Albany Bistro is the favorite destination for our girls' day out lunches!   The staff is accommodating, efficient and friendly.    Great prices, too!    Today, our group had the snapper with rice and asparagus, the Bistro burger, and the meatloaf plate.  We were all raving that ours was the best choice!   (And we were all right!)

name: Kelli Lovelace
text: This is no longer Albany Bistro. A wonderful new breakfast café has opened. Whisked. They open very early and are open every day. The food is delicious and the options are varied... everything from a light breakfast to an over flowing omelet.

name: Julianne Hansen
text: I have visited this establishment many MANY times and have NEVER been disappointed in the service or the food!  It's a lovely place with an outstanding menu.  Compliments to the chef are given each and every time I experience Albany Bistro!

name: Sam Grey
text: Service is great and not overly attentive.  Fried oysters were outstanding, as was the beef tenderloin.  Love this place.

name: Celieboo
text:
Great menu. Intimate setting. Friendly staff. Lunch prices are more affordable than dinner, but the food is quality!
I went for lunch and enjoyed it so much tha I went back fo dinner.

name: Blake Singleton
text: I've eaten here twice. Both times the food has been excellent. If the prices were a little lower (not much, two people can comfortably eat here for less than $100), it'd be a 5 star rating.

name: Gail Blenis
text: Such a quaint little place. We loved the atmosphere and the food was delicious.  Try the fried chicken....so good!!!

name: Jeremy Bowling
text: Excellent lunch experience. I really enjoyed the food and thought it was reasonably priced. The Blueberry Cheesecake for dessert was perfection!

name: Brandon Patterson
text: Great service and the food is simply amazing. Thank you Albany Bistro for the great experience.

name: Kristin T
text: Love this place! Such yummy food and the people here are fantastic! It's our favorite restaurant!

name: Chris Latham
text: Hands down the best restaurant in the Tennessee Valley. Great service, amazing food, and lovely atmosphere.

name: Josh
text: This is a great spot to relax and enjoy a finely crafted sandwich from the many choices while enjoying a great view outside.

name: TJ Brakefield
text:
Chef Jacob knows great food. Located approx. .3 miles off the main strip it's a very interesting environment paired with wonderfully prepared and plated dishes. I highly recommend the beef stroganoff, provided it does not rotate off the menu.
P.s. don't rotate the beef stroganoff.

name: Carolyn Binger
text: Absolutely delicious! Best meatloaf I have ever had

name: Keith Morgan
text: Food was excellent. We will be back. Make a reservation they are busy.

name: Lindsey Faulkner
text: Exquisite food, atmosphere,  and service!

name: Christina Simmons
text: My friend and I decided to try this restaurant out for lunch one day.  When we arrived the lady taking our order told us they were out of basically half the menu and the menu is not very big to begin with.  I ordered a chicken salad sandwich and mashed potatoes, they were extremely plain tasting, not enough seasoning...But edible.  My friend ordered a salad which she paid $8.99 for, and all she got was a small bowl of lettuce, a little bit of chicken, some crutons, and some dressing.  I felt really bad for her, because when she was finished she was still very hungry, but didn't have time to go anywhere else and get anything before going back to work.  Maybe this place needs to call Chef Ramsey from Kitchen Nightmares to help them out, haha.

resp.text: Christina we would definately like to have the chance to prove that our food is above ordinary.  Because we are an independent, chef-owned business, we take great pride in bringing the freshest, highest quality products to the table.  There are times that we choose to let our inventory run low...usually before holidays or times when we know we will be closed for an extended period of time. It's not that we are ill-prepared, instead we try to bring only the best to the table.  We sincerely apologize for the "nightmare" you & your guests experienced here.  We hope you will give us a chance to show you a truly great lunch.

name: Shenon Williams
text: I wish i could give this place zero stars!!!!  My cousin rented out the place for his wedding reception they bragged on how this is their favorite place. They must not have recieved such harsh service as i did. There was a server assigned to our table she was a delight. But for some reason another very rude disrespectful server kept approaching me. I felt as if i was in high school and she was a bully. She was very aggressive towards me for no reason and kept coming to our table to address me as uf she wanted to start a arguement. She damn near snatched my glass of water away from me and continued to harrass me throughout the night. Now it was obvious to everyone at the table she was a bully. The crazy thing about this whole situation is that SHE WASNT EVEN MY SERVER!!!!  there was no reason for her to come to our table in the first place and the fact she continued to come back and harass me was. Crazy.   When i told the manager about this server he chumped me off as if i was just complaining to complain. I am a bartender so i know all about customer service. And This place is the worst. I hope they stay closed so no one else has to endure what i went through. I am soooooooo pissed. I wish thetevwas more i could do to keep this place closed. I have never been so disrespected in my life.

name: Christian Smith
text: Great atmosphere, and even better food. A Decatur favorite.

name: Drew Williams
text: Awesome place. A hidden gem of Decatur

name: Phil Ryu
text: Great food and kind servers

name: Jimmy Ray Smith
text: Such a nice restaurant

name: Gay Campbell
text: Sorry to hear it closed

name: Gus Parker III
text: dont trust the smiles in this. place...we used our debit card and then started having fraud charges. called management and they were no help.  Filing Police report to recover our charges

name: Chris Spivey
text: We ordered the steak thinking this would be a nice place to eat. Not the case. I cant speak for the breakfast but the steak dinner was the worst I have ever eaten. Touch and over cooked.

name: John Ehrhart
text: $18 for a plank of salmon with BBQ sauce on top and what tasted like microwaved frozen mixed vegetables with rice. Took over 20 minutes. Bartender was good though, very attentive.

name: Gus P Music
text: I used my cash app card to pay for breakfast.  I’ve had fraudulent activity every since.

name: Film Maker
text: Thought this was a nice place until credit card information was compromised.

name: Music Publisher
text: unless you want your identity stolen....sty away from this place.

name: Gus Parker
text: Someone that works there is a theif.

name: gmoney milli
text: DONOT use your credit card

name: Brad Doucette
text: Very good breakfast

name: Roger Hornbrook
text: Good stugg

name: pizza hutbetter
text: Bad management

name: Dale Webster
text: Always

name: Yessi Esquivel
text:
(Translated by Google) It's not worth what you pay for what they sell you

(Original)
No vale la pena lo que pagas por lo que te venden

name: Kevin Taylor
text: They always are great. Very nice customer  service. Food great. I call it in and they  have it at window immediately. Always correct too!

name: Zanita David
text: Great food, great service and beautiful clothes and jewelry available for purchase

name: JERRI LEIGH FOSTER
text: Friendly and helpful. Great food!

name: Black Sheep Mowers
text: Awesome ☕

name: Christy Hales
text: The food here was amazing and the staff was very friendly and even gave us some fresh orange juice to sample.  The wait for our to-go order was on the long side and the prices were higher than most places nearby (about $8 for a sandwich), but the quality of the food was outstanding and it was well worth the wait and the price.  All of the produce is clearly very fresh and the portions were generous.  The sandwiches come with amazing seasoned chips (or crackers?  I'm not sure what they are other than delicious) and salsa as well as a few pieces of fresh fruit.  I can't wait for my next opportunity to go back.

name: Quinn Calvert
text:
A small place with a quaint sort of homely feel. I got the Sicily sandwich, and it was phenomenal - exactly the sort of Italian flavors I was looking for on a hot summer day. The sides are fairly limited, but the chips and salsa aren't bad. Couldn't help but feel the salsa was lacking something: a zest, tang, spice, idk. It just seemed a bit too bland.

But that's really the only demerit. Overall a great mix of value, flavor, and portion size.

name: Vic Robertson
text: Avocado Turkey Sandwich on jalapeño bread. EXCELLENT! Friendly service. Comfortable seating. Dine indoors or outside.

name: Angel M
text: I visit Huntsville often for leisure and dental meetings and happen to come across this cafe, I absolutely admire this cafe....The waitress was exceptionally sweet and the food was divine. This is a cafe that I'd highly recommend for breakfast or brunch..

name: Stephanie Pierce
text: I went to Sady's Bistro today, 4/18/15, with my mom and the experience wasn't great. I believe it opens at 8 and we got there around 8:45. When we walked in there was one lady ahead of us and she was told by the workers in the back that the server had not arrived yet. We had been waiting a few minutes when finally the server showed up. My mom ordered spinach and egg crepes and I ordered what I thought was a quesadilla with basil goat cheese. We sat down and my mom's crepes came out fairly quickly and I continued to wait. After maybe 10 minutes the server came back and said that they were out of basil goat cheese so I switched fr another and waited. While I was still waiting a couple that had ordered after us both got their meals and mine had yet to come. Finally after maybe 25 minutes mine finally arrived. it was 2 tiny toasted tortillas a few slices of tomato and a little cup of goat cheese and 2 pieces of bacon. When we asked why it had taken so long she basically just blamed the workers in the back and gave a rushed sorry as she walked away. I just found the whole experience very off-putting and do not think I will be returning.

name: Olivia Brannon Pirtle
text:
The quality of the service and the time it takes to order food is quite unfortunate. I used to frequent this place at least once a week.

I wish it would return to its old glory.

name: Andrew Ohlinger
text: The smoothies are made from fresh fruit and, the french toast was great! Best place in Madison to stop for good food and a nice outdoor atmosphere.

name: Kimberly Christmas
text: Food was good. Not what I expected but I would go back. Nothing to write home about.

name: Scott Harden
text: This is a nice little hole-in-the-wall sandwich shop. They have tasty sandwiches and the deserts look awesome!

name: Eric Leavitt
text: This is probably the best small restaurant in Madison. Its a little pricey, and if you come during off hours it can take a bit, but its all well worth it. Food is fresh, and tastes home-made with excellent ingredients. I haven't had anything on their menu that I felt was "bad for me" after eating it (and they have nutella crepes...). Oh, and they serve their breakfast items all day, which is like finding a unicorn in this town. I tend to go with a buildyourown salad, but their sandwhiches are also very good.

name: Mikey P
text: Low prices and great food!

name: Samar Misra
text: I love the people here!  They are so warm, friendly and helpful.  Earlier today, I ordered a vegan pizza with certain ingredients, but when I arrived and noticed the lack of ingredients, ome sweet, sincere employee in the cafe made me a whole separate one free.  Plus, one manager provided me a treat of getting a free vegan jerky after trying to cancel a soup from my doordash menu.  Love them!

resp.text: We are pleased to serve you. Blessings. Thank you.

name: John Desouza
text: Amazing Chef made vegan and delicious vegetarian Food

name: Kim Styers
text: This place is awful!! Hours are ridiculous this hotel and bistro avoid at all cost!!!

name: Daniel Rivera
text: Great spot for travelers. It's a cross between a vibrant euro cafe and a coffee shop. Wait staff has superb southern hospitality. The morning waiter, Janice, and chef are fantastic. Please get Tabasco, it's America's staple hot sauce, pretty please.

name: Tyler Garamella
text: Food was good, and the women working the bistro that night gave stellar customer service. Place was clean and well maintained.

name: nick nadeau
text: Food was ok, presentation was nice. A little over priced (avacado toast and a small fruit bowl was $15 ish plus tax). You're better off eating at chic filet a across the street. The coffee was good though!

name: Jee Suh
text: Same Bistro as other Courtyard chains.  This particular location the staff is slow and confused (forgets things), out of menu items, and not as good as other Courtyard Bistros.

name: jozzy allman
text: Not bad for a small hotel snack bistro operation. The fried brussel sprouts were amazing!

name: Anita Alef
text: Extremely overpriced pizza was very good very small selection I went for the 50% off tasty Tuesday and still spent $50 for three people

name: Jorge Romero
text: Very Nice place  a good drinks

name: Scott Tugya
text: The cuisine, specifically the duck, was absolutely phenomenal, as was the New Zealand lamb. The staff was professional and polite. The interior of the restaurant was spotless and inviting. In short it was a very pleasant evening to a rather tumultuous Monday. I highly recommend this establishment for fine dining. My only critique is that is was a rather difficult find for me; in that, it was recommend by Yankee Candel staff at the Huntsville Mall, I guess dinner recommendations come in all manner...

name: Bill Thygerson
text:
Stopped by for a quick lunch, and was glad I did.

The soup of the day, cream of artichoke, was thick, hot, creamy (duh), and excellent.  I hope they have it again soon.

The chicken medallions marsala with wild mushrooms included sides of garlic mashed potatoes and vegetable medley were beautifully presented and delicious.

Then there was the  "Chocolate Eruption" -- a generous slice of chocolate cake filled with chocolate mousse, chunks of cheesecake, toffee, and caramel topped with whipped cream and chocolate.   It was magnificent.

Our server was friendly, knowledgeable, and always there when you needed her. Prices were very reasonable.

All in all, a VERY pleasant experience.  Highly recommended.  We'll be back for sure.

name: LifeChange35
text: Excellent food and service. Fresh yummy local!!!

name: Harold Burkett
text: Just ate here for the first time. Came for a romantic anniversary dinner with my wife and they did not disappoint. One of the few places I've eaten where the food served looked as picture perfect as the website. Service was excellent and food was delicious. Will return soon.

name: Ashley Pallotta
text: This place has possibly the best food in Huntsville. And price is extremely reasonable, especially during lunch hours! The setting is adorable, especially the outdoor patio. We love their chicken cordon bleu, beef tips, and at dinner their chicken Alfredo is amazing ($16).

name: Todd Town
text: Great staff! Wade runs a tight ship. Can't wait for the remodel to be complete!

name: Mary Jo Kinzer
text: A great place to go for date night. Food and service are excellent.

name: Justin Rosoff
text: Great food, service can be slow but worth the visit.

name: Jose Rivera
text: When't with my girlfriend for our very first official date, and the way her face lit up when she saw the table in the back was worth every penny. Will always recommend.

name: K.D. Kromminga (Gnostic Heathen)
text: D&L Bistro is out of business please remove their listing.

name: N Grothe
text: The place is currently closed for renovations - and 7/27/2017

name: Nick Tucker
text: Smells like delicious seafood walking in.

name: jonah thompson
text: Great place

name: Harvie Kruer
text:
This place has been "closed for renovations" since November 2016. I have tried going here four times since then and it still isn't open as of today (10/06/2017) Clearly there are some serious issues that need to be resolved with this establishment. Such a shame.
Edit: Still closed as of (2/28/2018)
